newsitem.title: CANADA: Loewen says Florida probes Service bid.
newsitem.headline: Loewen says Florida probes Service bid.

text.p: The Loewen Group Inc said Friday that Florida's attorney general is conducting an anti-trust investigation of Service Corp International's proposed takeover of Loewen.
Loewen, North America's second biggest funeral home and cemetery operator, said it received a civil subpoena for documents in connection with the probe.

Loewen said the subpoena suggests "a wide ranging investigation into the potential impact of the proposed acquisition on pricing, Medicare/Medicaid issues and market concentration for cemeteries and funeral homes" in Florida.
Service Corp is biggest operator in the industry. Loewen this week rejected a US$2.8 billion bid by Service, which is widely expected to launch a higher hostile bid next week.

"We welcome the scrutiny of the Florida attorney general's office and other state regulators as well, since SCI clearly intends to eliminate its most formidable competitor in the North American marketplace," said chief executive Ray Loewen.
A Loewen spokesman said the company knew of no other states with investigations underway.
A combined Service Corp and Loewen would have a 23.4 percent share of funeral homes in Flordia, according to the New York Times.
Loewen has said it believes anti-trust concerns would be a major obstacle to the takeover, but many industry analysts have discounted that theory, saying anti-trust hurdles could be overcome.
